intro: Disticholiparis ochrantha, commonly known as the red-stemmed devil's backbone, is a striking member of the Roridulaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, elongated, and often reddish stems that bear small, clustered leaves. The plant produces unique, lantern-like flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species in many regions.
